title: China’s Baowu steel to study investment in Sri Lanka: embassy
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – China’s Baowu Steel will study the feasibility of an investment in Hambantota in Sri Lanka, which may lead to a billion dollar investment, the island’s embassy in Beijing said.
Sri Lanka’s ambassador to Beijing Palitha Kohona had visited Baowu Steel group’s offices in Ma’anshan, Anhui and met senior management to discuss investment potential in Sri Lanka.
“Baowu Steel will prepare a feasibility study on making a substantial investment in Hambanthota, Sri Lanka,” the embassy said in a statement.
China’s CM Ports group which operates a both in Hambantota also runs a connected investment zone.
Baowu Steel had revenues of 673 billion yuan (105 billion US dollars) in 2020 according to its website.
Baowu is now the world’s largest producer by volume oafter vertaking Europe’s Arcellor Mittal.  (Colombo/Mar18/2022)
